result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather R. Sheehan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Heather R. Sheehan is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Heather R. Sheehan was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  
*  Pay fine of $200.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.   
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.

timeConds.notes: to allow P&P to make preparations for the DE's release.

supervisions.notes:
PROBATION REVOKED  -  Concurrent to Racine Co case 15CF9 & 09CF1252
**JOC AMENDED TO SHOW AMOUNT OF SENTENCE CREDIT**

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Submit a DNA sample (unless prevoiusly provided)  Follow all rules & regulations in Racine Co cases 15CF9 & 09CF1252.  
*  All previously ordered fines & costs are reimposed.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.

supervisions.notes: **ANY UNPAID COURT OBLIGATIONS ARE STILL TO BE COLLECTED.**

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Matthew Perz.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  2:03pm-  Defendant sentenced to WSP 3 years:  1 year initial confinement & 2 years extended supervision - concurrent to Racine Co case 15CF9 & 09CF1252.  Credit for 318 days.  Any previously ordered fines & costs are reimposed.  DE to submit DNA sample (unless previously done).  DE is eligible for CIP & SAP.  Appeal rights given.

records.addlTxt: Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Everett King.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  1:37pm-  Matter is resolved.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1; found guilty by the court.  On the motion of the State, counts 2 & 3 are dismissed.  Parties waive the right to a PSI.  Court proceeds to sentencing.  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 18 months w/conditions.  96 days sentence credit if revoked.    Court orders 14 days conditional jail to allow probation & parole to make preparations for the DE's release.  Court orders $200.00 fine plus costs, drug surcharge & DNA surcharge.  DE to submit DNA sample (unless previously done).  Appeal rights given.
Bail/bond hearing on July 15, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Due to ongoing jury trial (State v. Martinez), 6/26/2014 Final pre-trial is rescheduled.  Bond motion was filed.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for 7/15/2014 at 1:15pm.  NTBS by  the Court.
